245 leaves (iv + 241)

The edges savagely retrimmed, affecting marginalia, and spattered with red.
supportDesc.collation: A bifolium, 1-178, 184(+ 1 after 4), 19-308, 314(lacks 1-2); catchwords; quire-signatures of the usual late medieval form.

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled with pencil; written in 2 cols of c. 52 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Written in a proficient bastard anglicana, except for art. 5, added in a rough gothic rotunda bookhand. The main scribe writes extensive passages in red.

decoDesc.decoNote: English. On f. 1 is a 12-line S in colours and gold with full border (cf. Scott, DDEMB, pl. Ia); 6-line champe initials fols. 36v, 82, 142, 156, 196v, 212, 220; blue initials flourished in red; blue paraphs, red highlighting; running heads in red with blue paraphs.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii, repaired and rebacked; sewn on six bands; formerly chained from the usual position. Fols. i-ii, 240-1 are modern paper binding leaves. f. 239, formerly a pastedown in an earlier binding, has the mark of an iron chain-staple at the foot.

history.provenance: Made in England; at the College by 1556: UO65. 108. ‘112’ is inked on the foredge.

Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with a table of contents, s. xvii, and ‘P. 1. 12. art:’, canc. and replaced with ‘N. 1. 9’ and (CCXV)’ in red which has faded badly and been replaced in pencil; the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.
